edu.cpp.cs.cs141.GECLYfinalproj

Class Ninja

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.GECLYfinalproj.Agent
      • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.GECLYfinalproj.Ninja
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Locatable, java.io.Serializable

    public class Ninja
extends Agent
implements Locatable, java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a Ninja Assassin, which is a subclass of the Agent abstract class. The game will start by creating three instances of this class.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • objectCanBeMovedOver

        public boolean objectCanBeMovedOver(Locatable l,
                                    Direction d)
        Description copied from class: Agent
        Checks whether this agent can move to a certain object in a certain direction. Returns true for players moving down into rooms, even though that does not actually result in movement.
        Specified by:
        objectCanBeMovedOver in class Agent
        Parameters:
        l - the object to be moved over
        d - the direction to move in
        Returns:
        whether a move in the specified direction to a spot on the grid containing the specified object is valid

      • makeMovementDecision

        public void makeMovementDecision(java.util.Random random)
        Figures out which ways it can move, and if it can move somewhere, it does. If it is next to the player, it will move in the direction of the player. Decision is made randomly.
        Parameters:
        random - The Random that is used to make random decisions.

      • makeMovementDecision

        public void makeMovementDecision(java.util.Random random,
                                 Locatable target)
        Figures out which way this ninja can move, and if it can, it does. It will attempt to move towards the specified Locatable.
        Parameters:
        random - The Random that is used to make random decisions.
        target - the Locatable (probably the player) to move towards
